intro: Erigeron polymorphus subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually gray-green and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in arid environments.
